website_summaries.verdict: Popular model of double suction cup handle offering a 220-pound lifting capacity and perfect handle size.
pros: Gives you an aluminum body and a heavy-duty plastic handle, meaning it will stand up to tough jobs well
Handles up to 220 pounds of lifting load capacity
Good size at 13 by 4.8 by 4.5 inches
Very reasonable price point for this versatile tool
cons: May not provide a high level of suction on rough surfaces

website_summaries.verdict: With a heavy duty aluminum body, this double suction cup lifts up to 220 pounds in level and 200 pounds in vertical.
pros: Lifting load capacity of 220 pounds in level
Intended for lifting and handling glass, sheet metal and plane surface materials
Operation requires experience using heavy duty suction cups
cons: While the tool itself is very strong, the plastic tabs can break

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use to fix a couple of places that the planks on my floor have gapped and it works perfectly. They moved back together and this did not leave a mark. Saved me so much money because I thought I would have to replace the flooring. You place the suction cups on the board next to the gap, parallel with the long side of the board and hit the device with a rubber mallet to move the planks back into place. My flooring is over cement subfloor and when the weather changes they shift just a little bit and of course the gap is in the most noticeable spot, never under the rug. This did the trick!!!
customer_reviews.author: A Shopper 2018

customer_reviews.title: Great for making your own wake maker
customer_reviews.text: For those of you out there that are gonna make your own wake maker this is a great product. Alot of these are plastic which isnt gonna be very durable when you have water pushing on it all the time. I bought this one because it is heavy duty aluminum. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for what?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use "off label". I read of folks using these to tighten gaps in laminate flooring. This little gem does the trick quite nicely for less than half the cost. No marring whatsoever! Finished in no time at all. Love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Willie Maykit

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an odd purpose. I needed to close up some gaps forming in a laminate/wood floor. This gave me great suction and I tapped it with a rubber mallet to close up the gaps. Don’t hit it with a metal hammer or it will chip the paint. It worked great for that purpose, but it’s an excellent glass puller as well. I was really impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Walker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews that were mostly good so I decided to buy two of these units to install a shower enclosure. The glass was in three pieces the lightest being 85 lbs and the heaviest 120. I bought two because I was afraid of one slipping and causing the glass to fall. Well these worked so well that I wanted my money buying the second unit one was all that was needed. If the glass is clean just setting the unit on the surface almost sticks so well the you can hardly get it back off. Once you use the levers to apply suction there is no way these would slip.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Gapped laminate floors no more !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glass pull to fix the gaps in my laminate floor . It did the job and did it very well . My floors are textured and matte the tool had great suction to my floors. Make sure you swiffer before you use it as it will not stick if there is dust on the floors. Now my floors are as good as new ! I am soooooo happy!!!! I had a contractor come by and quote me 1500 to pull up and re click the floors in my hallway. So glad I didn’t waste the money! this glass puller does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Fred and Steph

customer_reviews.title: Worked great moving a 450lb tub
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to assist in moving a 450lb tub. Worked great. I couldn't attach it to the sides of the tub due to the curvature of tub but I was able to attach it to the bottom where it was flat. I just needed this handle to get the tub off the pallet and onto dollies and off dollies and down onto drain pipe. There is absolutely no where to grab ahold of my free standing tub as it has no lips or anything to grab so this suction cup handle was a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Andrew

customer_reviews.title: These Suck
customer_reviews.text: I bought these suckers with handles to remove and install some heavy double glazed windows. They worked great! Really sucked hold of the glass and no leaks. The construction is designed for a long life of use. I recommend buying them and making things safer for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: BillWill

customer_reviews.title: Super strong suction - very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these primarily to remove and replace a plate glass mirror (46" x 62"). I bought 4, which was probably overkill, but the last thing I wanted was to risk injury from broken glass. Let me say that these suction cups work great. The suction is super powerful. The construction is very solid and they fit very comfortably in your hands. The only concern I might have is that the levers are plastic, but they are very heavy duty, so I doubt they will break. Next project is to disassemble a glass shower enclosure. Really glad I have them. I would highly recommend them to anybody that needs to move large plate glass windows or mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: I have a what they call a floating floor in living room where the boards are separating and looking kind of bad. I saw some other people using this product ...
customer_reviews.text: I know this was made to carry glass but I used it for another purpose. I have a what they call a floating floor in living room where the boards are separating and looking kind of bad. I saw some other people using this product for that purpose . All i can say is it worked for me. I put this on floor and used a rubber hammer to tap them into place. Quick easy and did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Joma

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Grip
customer_reviews.text: I plan on using these for removing the crawlspace access door under a hardwood floor. Wanted to avoid any obvious signs there is a door there and have it be seamless. Saw some other people were using it to fix shifted hardwood floors. These will definitely provide the grip needed. Not sure If i would use these for any heavy industrial / commercial applications but would be comfortable using them for handling light pieces of glass.
customer_reviews.author: Rx

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these to install a 57”L x18”W x 3/4” thick granite fireplace hearth estimated to weigh 75-100 lbs (new fireplace under construction). Without these, the slab of granite would have been impossible to hold, test the fit of the hearth into the cut-out in the wood floor, remove it after the test, and then install with the stone adhesive. These yellow glass holders worked perfectly, held securely, and were unbelievably less expensive than other options. I have to admit that I did not really trust them to hold securely, so we never held the granite more than a couple inches off the floor. But they did hold securely and worked perfectly. Thank you seller!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: High quality and power
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the cups to install new gloss shower doors in the bathroom. Tried the cups and made sure that they are working as supposed in accordance with technical specification. After the test I have no doubt about ability of the cups to complete the doors installation with no issue. The cups are really heavy duty. I gave 5 stars for their quality and power. My special thanks for unexceptionable service of the cups seller. They resolved the issue I got immediately.
customer_reviews.author: ILY

customer_reviews.title: fixed laminate floor gaps
customer_reviews.text: I was at a loss on how to fix the laminate on my living room and bedroom floors that had separated in spots. I happened upon a you tube video that showed how to use a suction cup device with wood glue and a mallet to gently tap the boards back together. This device was exactly what I needed. It is metal and took quite a beating to get a couple of the boards back together. I would buy this again and have already had requests from friends to borrow it so they can fix their floors.
customer_reviews.author: budbeau

customer_reviews.title: Great for fixing LVT
customer_reviews.text: After watching a video on how to close gaps in floating floor tiles/wood, I decided to give it a try. Our laundry room floor is luxury vinyl tile and had developed up to 1/4" gaps in places. The tiles are somewhat textured, very hard, and heavy so I doubted that the suction would even hold after hitting the handle with a rubber mallet. It worked perfectly! It took a while, but the tiles slid into place and the floor looks so much better!! Glad I bought the metal one instead of the plastic because it will stand up better in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were a lifesaver, or at least a back and foot saver. We were remodeling our master bath. We have 85 lb glass doors that, after moving, caused plantar fasciitis in my left foot. I was apprehensive about lifting our large granite slab onto our bathroom counter, since I had just gotten a steroid shot in that foot. We attached three of these to our slab of granite, and easily lifted it onto a cart for moving to the bathroom. When we lifted into place on the cabinet, they worked perfectly, and we were able to easily move the slight amount we needed to. Wish we had ordered these before moving the glass. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: B Grvs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moving my big mirror.
customer_reviews.text: Had a 4 x 4 glass mirror that I had to move and reinstall after a remodel project for my bathroom. This took allowed me to "grip" the mirror with leverage. I jus made sure that the mirror surface was clean, and I kept the tool clean. I do recommend this product. Just make sure you put the tool back clean, and keep it in bag so it stays clean.
customer_reviews.author: Garnie In Texas

customer_reviews.title: Secure Handle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to use during a recent glass shower door installation. I had to lift a 60lb tempered glass plate into position. The tool provided a secure non-slip grip on the glass, and the grip was comfortable to grab with my hand. I was skeptical that a tool priced at this cost would be up to the task, but it seems to be well-fabricated and worked to perfection for me. I like the bright yellow color -- making it easy to locate among a debris and other materials and tools. Now I think I'll use it during my next project, to lift and place heavy large profile ceramic tile into position. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miffy

customer_reviews.title: Review: Laminate floor gaps
customer_reviews.text: Update:Tried to use again and the suction is nearly impossible on my vinyl plank floors. I think it’s because of the texture. Piece of junk. Two more stars deducted for my frustration. Took a little while for the suction to work....didn’t immediately adhere right out of the box. Once we got it working it did the job, had to put a lot of weight into it before using the levels. It did slide a little when I whacked it with a mallet, which kind of defeats the purpose! It seems solid and was a decent price, so I’ll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a short time
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to tighten up some joints after replacing some damaged luxury vinyl planks. It gripped very well and worked great...for 4 applications. On the fifth, one of the levers snapped at the base rendering that side useless. Amazon sent a replacement that I only had to apply a couple times to finish the job. So would be a great value if the levers were stronger; hopefully it was just a defect and not a design flaw but the project is over and hopefully won't have to be repeated anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: wck

customer_reviews.title: Every suction cup on Earth is only as good as it's seal
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Absolutely essential when my brother and I installed the glass shower panel. Pro-tip - Do not throw away the box or the plastic bag that it wrapped around it. If exposed to the elements in storage, the rubber deteriorates, so keeping these stored inside the plastic will protect them. Every suction cup on Earth is only as good as it's seal, and damaged rubber does not make a good seal. Keep the rubber clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S.

customer_reviews.title: Had to return because it did not work :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping I could use it to fix some areas of my laminate flooring. Unfortunately it was pretty much useless. It did not grip well, had low strength, and I couldn’t make any repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Works but plastic snapped
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to move floating wood floor planks, and it works for that. It was small enough to fit over one of our wide boards. The main body is strong, but the plastic black levers must be cheaper, because when we released one of them to release the suction, it snapped back so hard that it hit the metal frame and broke it. We wrote Qadira about it but never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Frazzle

customer_reviews.title: 2 handles secured 80-pound sliding glass door
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help my wife and I safely remove an 80-pound sliding glass door from its tracks to replace the rollers. The size and awkwardness of this large door made safe handling a challenge. The breadth of the door made it too wide for my wife's arms to reach across. The suction handles held firmly and allowed the two of us to easily and safely pull out the door, replace the rollers and replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Peters

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Great service. One weak point.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good and well-made product. There is one weak point though: the plastic lever or "wrench" that pulls the suction cup back to create the suction, broke under the forces of security the suction cups. The support team was responsive and sent a replacement right away, and the product is otherwise well made. But this is a weak point in the design and so should be noted. The suction pressure they apply is pretty impressive though and the metal casing for the handle is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for awkward heavy lifting.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these to ease the transfer of a 100 gallon fish tank from my garage into my house. Tank weighed 255lbs dry, and each suction cup was rated at 250lbs. Did the trick and happy I decided to go with them! even got them to work on some heavy furniture!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good for more than just glass
customer_reviews.text: I use this for an odd application...I have an aluminum toolbox in the bed of my company vehicle. The boxes I have in the toolbox constantly slid and knocked around, driving me crazy. I tried weighted bags to stop the sliding, but they slid too...and being aluminum, magnets wouldn't work on the toolbox either. I tried one of these suction devices as a divider to hold the boxes in place and voila! Rock solid and no more banging. These are well made and the suction is very strong, at least for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for personal safety.
customer_reviews.text: The most dangerous place for an ancient senior is in the shower. A slip is a death sentence. I have a well equipped handicap shower at home, but traveling and visiting other peoples homes with marble or ceramic showers is scary. Answer: This vacuum grip device made for handling plate glass is perfect. It fits in my suitcase and can be installed in the shower by flipping the two levers. When leaving just flip the levers and take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Allen

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations esp. for the money
customer_reviews.text: Suction worked great installing 2 showers doors each weighing 75 lbs. Handles were comfortable. Easy to use. Just remember to keep the pads clean. After use, I kept them in the plastic bags that they came in and stored them in the box. I have a good feeling that if you keep them clean and not in extreme temperatures they will continue to work good as the day I got them.
customer_reviews.author: zentogo

customer_reviews.title: My flooring guy wanted to know where I got it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix a few spots in our floating bamboo floor that had slid out of place and left small gaps in between planks. A year later we had to get some of our flooring replaced due to water damage and the flooring guy was so amazed at it he wanted to know where I got it. He said it made his job a bunch easier. So I guess this is a great tool! It worked great for me to touch up gaps in the floor.
customer_reviews.author: E. Low

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sucking power!  ;)
customer_reviews.text: I have a glass top desk and have had two of these suckers stuck on the underside for five days now. They haven't budged. This gives me the confidence to use these to carry large storm windows up ladders with more safety than just bare handing it. They are light sturdy and work better than any cups I've ever tried. An unbeatable value.
customer_reviews.author: millard fillmore

customer_reviews.title: Great suction!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical but these things really worked! Used them for large format travertine tile installation and installing our glass shower door. They made the tiling so much easier and had a better looking result as compared as to when we tiled without them. Would definitely recommend for large tile installations!! (Tiles do have to be flat and untextured in order for them to suction)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Orth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this! Was nervous it wouldn't stay stuck with so much sun light but is going strong! And actually can't get it off without crazy pull force! Our back patio door handle fell off from being so old(20+ yrs). Lost handle so I needed something to open slider door from outside instead of pushing in on door a bit to slide opened. Works amazing. I would recommend it to anyone. Looks ghetto but does the trick!!!
customer_reviews.author: tabitha kerr

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I can say this product sucks and it is a compliment. First time ever! I saw a video on YouTube on how to lay wood floors so the seams are tight. They recommended this product. It worked! It made laying the floor so much easier. I definitely will tell everyone about this product. (I have not and probably will never find out how it works on glass. But it works great on wood and laminate floors.)
customer_reviews.author: Trollhair

customer_reviews.title: Wonder if anyone else found this use for it-
customer_reviews.text: My wife is disabled and has difficulty standing, and this is particularly evident when taking a bath. She uses a handicap bench that sits in the tub and sometimes must stand up. The tub/ shower enclosure is one piece fiberglass and this handle was easy to attach to the seamless back wall. It is most useful and a godsend.
customer_reviews.author: Moishe Yidbaum

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this suction handle!!
customer_reviews.text: When I needed to use one at home I thought buying one was out of the question. I seem to remember years back when I used them at work I thought they were fairly expensive. I was surprised not only at the price but the quality for the price!! This tool will more than handle anything I will ever need to use it for! This is a good tool worth taking care of!!
customer_reviews.author: Blasthoff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent holding power for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I found the glass puller to be an great purchase. For the money - it was more than what I had expected. I used it to remove/replace 10 residential windows of varying size and weight. Grab handle and suction release all worked well. Also received a compliment from the local glass company representative who noticed the puller attached to the windows - when I brought some of the old windows into the shop area for measurement prior to replacement ordering. Good product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lifting glass top table!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a glass top table several years ago, and over the years it has accumulated lots of debris. It was pretty unsightly, but we weren’t really sure how to remove the glass to clean since it’s huge and sets into the table. Purchased two of these and placed on opposite sides of the glass, we were able to easily lift the glass and clean it. Finally! So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: These suck! (but, in this case that's a good thing!)
customer_reviews.text: Usually, when you say something "sucks" -- it's a bad thing... But, not in this case! These suction clamps really suck! I was able to lift-off heavy glass table tops with ease. A pair of these also comes in handy when carefully disassembling 45"+ sized LCD monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Dachshund Owner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Suction
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered quickly as promised. Much better quality than Harbor Freight version. Suction is really good. I bought for something I was building vs using as a tool for glass. For my application (very light) , the suction power was excellent. Pulling hard on the handle gave no budge and held firm and tight. Recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bj

customer_reviews.title: This product really sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and good suction on glass surfaces. I bought them to use as a temporary handle for the outside of a door that was designed as an exit only. During construction we still needed access in and out of that door and I did not want to block the door open. This product solved the problem. I bought two in case the first one walked.
customer_reviews.author: WOJO

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, not the greatest quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use to remove and re-glaze windows in our old greenhouse. The plastic levers that flip up and down to create suction are somewhat difficult to engage, and within the first half-hour one of them broke, about half of it broke off. The device still works. It turned out to be more heavy duty than we needed. Our panes of glass were only 24x17 inches (even though there were 184 of them) so if you have a smaller job this might be overkill.
customer_reviews.author: alycia brehm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to lift glass shower doors.
customer_reviews.text: We had knocked a glass shower door off its track, and it was too heavy for me to safely lift and put back on track without fear of slipping. It was going to cost $75 to have the handyman come out and do it. This was a much cheaper and better solution. Plus, I get to keep the tools. This things are very handy when I need to carry anything that is heavy and hard to get a good grip on. Love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Kitzmiller

customer_reviews.title: Buy two, be happy...
customer_reviews.text: Buy two, be happy. These work great. I use these mostly on large mirrors - say 3 x 5 feet and 1/4 thick and have never had a problem. With smaller, thinner mirrors I think you'd have to be careful not to "over power" the glass and break it. But, you should be careful anyway... Very glad we got these - wish we'd saved the box so we could have put them back and kept them cleaner between uses.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlandsman

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction on glass
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have some crank-style windows in my house that wont all close. I needed to log which ones so I can get them fixed. This suction cup was more than strong enough to do the job. Good quality construction. Only gripe would be the levers to activate suction are a little stiff. Overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gulliver

customer_reviews.title: Well made - exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to move a 1/2” glass top from a 60” round table when I needed to add leaves to the table. Extremely secure grip for a heavy piece of glass.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Great for glass handling
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to remove and replace 8 x 6 foot mirrors. They are excellent quality and work very well. I was able to unclip the mirrors and remove them by myself with little fear of breakage. My contractor told me he had never trusted suction cup devices but after watching me use these was going to purchase this product now.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Great for Floors
customer_reviews.text: Used this to fill some gaps back in on my linoleum floors and it works like a charm. Good solid grip. May take some effort to get the levers on the side down (especially once right out of the box) so I probably would not recommend for the elderly or people with muscle problems.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rindfuss

customer_reviews.title: No suction for vinyl flooring
customer_reviews.text: Not for vinyl flooring to adjust gaps. There is absolutely no suction when trying to adhere to vinyl flooring with a little bit of texture.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to do window replacements. I have several double pane windows that have broken seals. Had new insulated glass units built and used these suction cup tools to remove and replace the defective glass. Worked great. Have done about 5 of them now and have never had one of these pop off during installation. I use two though *just in case*, and for better handling.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to repair my laminate flooring like others, worked perfectly! My wife was in awe and our little daughter was amazed. Suction was so strong I’ve literally walked around the house suctioning it to things out of curiosity of what it would hold. Answer- everything!
customer_reviews.author: TJ Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my husband could attempt to push together laminate boards that separated in the hallway where a lot of traffic occurs, causing some gapping in one area. He said it worked, but just had to continue on down the hallway as closing one gap opens another. The consequences of a floating floor so to speak I guess. Glad I purchased this, otherwise he was going to take apart a large section to try snapping them all back together again.
customer_reviews.author: TracieC

customer_reviews.title: Quilters best friend
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at the similar but more pricy item for quilting and came across this gem. It works even better than I’d hoped. It would make a great handle for anything/anywhere. A friend has it now to do hardwood flooring and another friend used it to pull a dent out.
customer_reviews.author: roxycowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Laminate Floor LIfe Saver
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little gem to close the gaps in our laminate flooring, as an alternative the $50 version marketed for that specific purpose. It worked perfectly. The only advice I might offer anyone using it for his or her laminate floors is that if it starts to slide, use a little rubbing alcohol on the pads to clean them up. It should grip fine after that.
customer_reviews.author: KVR

customer_reviews.title: works well for closing pergo laminate floor gaps
customer_reviews.text: intended to use for closing my pergo laminate floor gaps. First it did not suck, I thought the product did not work, after cleaning both the planks and the rubber sucker, it sucks very tight. works very well for my floor.
customer_reviews.author: PeterC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They are better in every way than you think they will be. We moved a huge 135 gallon aquarium with half inch thick glass (=HEAVY) with 4 of these and it was so easy. And secure.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Great for tiles installation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it based on some YouTube recommendation. Previously I used the once with one suction but since I was preparing for a job with 2'x4' files, I needed something strong. Got two of them and they worked great! I made my life so much easier, picking up tiles, moving, placing on the wall and adjusting. I really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacek

customer_reviews.title: Qadira Suction Cup worked great.  Excellent suction for surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Qadira Heavy Duty Aluminum Suction Cup to allow me to close the gaps in my laminate floors. The suction is amazing on this and worked great for what I needed. I look forward to using it for other projects around the house. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dkcla

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 4 purchased worked as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4 of these to lift and move a 130 gallon aquarium. On one of them a black latch snapped off when trying to lock it in place on the first use, which made me scared to use the other three. We used them and they worked great. I just wish the one didn’t break. We were able to carry the aquarium up six steps with ease and then lift it on to its stand that is 36 inches high without losing suction. I’d definitely recommend these to other hobbyists, but know that for less than $13 bucks each you may not get the quality control for each one that you would with a more expensive suction devices.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W.

customer_reviews.title: Worth triple the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome for setting windows solo. Suction and hold is incredible, even in freezing temperatures. Grabs onto the glass and it won’t let go, even after releasing the suction you have to wiggle it before removing it from the window. Will buy again if this one ever wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Greene

customer_reviews.title: Not Feather Weight but that's a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm impressed. Best ever, and for that Price. Sturdy full Alu Body and smooth Rubber plates. Very strong suction that stays on for Hours. On a Project some stayed on even over night. I'm very happy with these. Absolutely recommended these to Colleagues many time by now.
customer_reviews.author: Motty

customer_reviews.title: Strong Frame Great suction
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I hopped for. I needed to tap some flooring planks back into place. The frame is thick aluminum, the suction cups create a tight strong seal. I was able to use a block of wood and a mallet to tap each plank into place. The handle did not slip, or dent. I got my job done and would gladly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job!
customer_reviews.text: I have Pergo XP laminate flooring that connects via tongue and groove and a few of the boards had separated where they connected, end to end, from normal foot traffic. I had tried other methods to tap the boards back into place but nothing worked. As soon as I receive this product today I got to work and within 10 minutes all of the gaps were fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Eggbert

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performance
customer_reviews.text: These suction cups made my shower glass surrounding installation seemed so easy. Two persons with two set of Qadira suction cups, we set the panel of glasses (3/8 thickness), 36x48, 36x78, and the door 30x78 into places with ease. I am not a professional installer, without these suction cups, lifting the glasses back and forth so many times to mark the drill holes on the walls and floor would have been an impossible task. Their suctions are very strong and solid. I cleaned the glass surface before putting the suction on it. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DanT

customer_reviews.title: Works great on glass...not so much for floors
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use this product to move installed cork flooring planks that had separated at the end seams (recommended tip I found online). This product was just a hair wider than plank and as thus didn’t grip. The floor planks are 4 inches wide. This is an excellent, high-quality product and my 3 star rating isn’t fair but it didn’t do what I purchased it for so I gave it the average rating.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Functioned as depicted
customer_reviews.text: Needed a device to clamp onto vinyl flooring so to adjust it's position. This clamp did the trick, held it's position and easily stood up to the hits from the mallet used to force the vinyl to close the gaps between pieces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I did buy these
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a tile job with 12x24 tiles in my kitchen. I'm so glad I did buy these, they made moving the large format tiles incredibly easy. My wife would secure this handle to each tile and back butter each tile before handing them to me to set. Very efficient, very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Chad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suction. Well made, added weight for better control.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to make it easier to cut fabric for quilting. I attached it to my Omnigrip 24"x6" quilt ruler which then allowed me greater control of my ruler while cutting and added another layer of safety while using my rotary cutter. I like the added weight as it helps prevent slippage when cutting. The suction is outstanding. I highly recommend this to quilters. I saw another version of it in a quilting catalog that sold for $3 more. It definitely wasn't as beefy as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Rothe

customer_reviews.title: Worked great closing the gaps in our floating LVP floor!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to close a few gaps in our LV floorboards and couldn't be happier with the result. I was nervous that the wood grain indentations in the vinyl wouldn't allow the suction cups to adequately adhere to the planks but it didn't seem to make any difference. The quality is excellent; I'm sure I'll find other projects that it will come in handy. If you're looking to close those unsightly gaps in your floating floor - look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Super grip, no slipping
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace second story windows and thought these would help. These definitely made the job easier and they did not lose suction or fall off. I had one handle on the outside of the window where my husband was and another on the inside of the window that I grabbed on to from inside the house. It worked great. Should have bought these years ago to move glass and mirrors and with our other window replacement efforts
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Use these in our shower in our rv. Have tried the plastic ones and they won't stick. These have been up on the shower walls now for a month and don't move at all when we go down the road. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Worked on pulling my floor pieces back together.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for the 4-star rating is that right after I got it, I tried it out, and when I flipped up the plastic black handle to release it from the floor, it must have sprung back and hit the metal part because it broke off and left a jagged edge. I was able to glue it back together with super glue. The trick is just to do a controlled release and not let it just flip up at full force.
customer_reviews.author: MusicMT

customer_reviews.title: No more laminate gaps.
customer_reviews.text: Great suction and easy to use. I was able to use this to repair gaps that started to appear in my laminate flooring. Just be careful lifting up the levers as they will snap back quickly. Overall good item and is make really well.
customer_reviews.author: Irene M

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional uses
customer_reviews.text: I got this suction handle just for the purpose of keeping my dogs in the tub during bath time. Anything marketed towards pet use tends to be overpriced so I went with this item instead, which was reasonably priced and well made. I have a smooth surface shower surround so this adhered really well with no slippage even when wet. I’m sure if you get it for it’s intended use and use it just once, you can find other uses for it later.
customer_reviews.author: Lindzey Castro

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to remove a mirror from a bathroom wall. I watched a youtube video on the basic method and it worked great. These are heavy duty and I waved money doing it myself rather than paying someone else to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ashford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: Best $14 spent! This tool helped me fix the gaps in my wood floors SO easily. It took this and my dollar store rubber mallet and now my wood floors looked back to new! Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy to Two

customer_reviews.title: Suction tool.
customer_reviews.text: We were redoing the bathroom and we wanted something to help us lift the new tile. We didn't realize the tile wasn't perfectly smooth so it didn't work. I think if it was completely smooth it would have worked.
customer_reviews.author: kathy l. spealman

customer_reviews.title: One of my Best Purchases
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these to move a 150 gal aquarium (empty of course) They made lifting and moving a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mical Caterina

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this to remove wooden slats from my table to uncover the tv in the table. I wasn’t sure how well it was going to work on wood, but it works great (the wood has a polyurethane coating). Super strong suction and super simple to use
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Very good suction cup.
customer_reviews.text: I got this suction cup to pull the screen off my IMac so I could update the hard drive, CPU and replace my cd drive with a SSD drive. This suction cup worked great it pulled the IMac screen right up and off and it sit the screen back on with ease. The cup held tight and never moved or slipped.
customer_reviews.author: ernie

customer_reviews.title: awesome suction, would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to build a surfgate/suckgate for my boat. Worked perfectly. Heavy duty handle, awesome suction, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Everything, and more.....:
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to pick up Solar Modules Glass, very good product Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Pena

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until I broke it. Don't ask. I gave it 5 stars because I broke it. Weird, huh? No, if I can break this tool, it will be great for you and will last!
customer_reviews.author: Ricia

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Bought it to slide Pergo flooring together that had developed a couple gaps over time. Locked on really tight and easy to tap the flooring back into place with a mallet. Really easy and quick. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Fixes floor gaps!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fix gaps in my laminate floor. It works perfectly. All I did was clean the floor, attach this, and hit it with a mallet. The suction works well and the frame/handle is heavy duty. There's much more expensive alternatives so I'm grateful that this one did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Talia

customer_reviews.title: Great for EVP Floor Gaps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix the gaps in my EVP floating floor. It worked like a charm and only took a few seconds to fix. After placement on the floor, I tapped it with a mallet and it clicked right in place!
customer_reviews.author: msprissy

customer_reviews.title: Laminate repair
customer_reviews.text: I needed to re-position a section of vinyl laminate flooring that had moved out from under the trim. No easy way to access it. Didn't know how well it would work because of a slight texture in the flooring, but for the price it was worth a try. The tool gripped firmly and stayed connected. Problem solved in moments
customer_reviews.author: David K Meade

customer_reviews.title: Good Suction !
customer_reviews.text: Used it to close end seams in laminate floor, Just put it on the laminate, stood on it and knocked the hell out of it with a ball peen hammer and closed the seams.
customer_reviews.author: B. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as it should!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to lift glass...this is the easiest tool for the job. Really grabs on and the yellow color makes it easy to see. Natural hand grip.Probably only has a fixed life as the rubber faces will eventually stiffen.
customer_reviews.author: S. Zimberoff

customer_reviews.title: Great suction.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bump laminate flooring into place when they shift over time and it works great. Excellent suction. Does the job I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The product, though inexpensive is sturdy and more than satisfactory. Better than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Bob

customer_reviews.title: Many purposes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace auto glass but have found so many great uses for this tool. Also used it to fix my click lock flooring that was starting to separate. Suck it to the floor and hit it with a hammer. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed a suction cup from a neighbor and it hurt my hand so bad I almost dropped my end of the mirror. I ordered two of these, one for each of us, because they looked comfortable. We used them to pull off a small vanity mirror glued to the wall and to move a huge 75" mirror. They performed great and were comfortable too!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great Suction power
customer_reviews.text: I use this to take off my Jeep Wrangler doors. Make the lifting easier and not so awkward. It works Great!!! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K. Nyara

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great
customer_reviews.text: We used these to install a 3 piece glass shower door. They held the glass perfectly every time we had to move it. Using these allowed us to do the job with just two people!
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: The little I've used it it seems like it holds really well I did Stick it to a piece of formica and after about three days it did release but I don't know how smooth at formica was so I would I would order again
customer_reviews.author: Oopoolman1

customer_reviews.title: Strong Grip
customer_reviews.text: so far on windows 54x28 they worked w ease. made it much easier to lift them out. We'll test them in the near future on some 48x70's. Grip was excellent
customer_reviews.author: ivy

customer_reviews.title: Love them, they worked prefect for my three big ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them, they worked prefect for my three big windows. Made it so much easier to handle them and putting them back in. No pinched fingers and helped a lot getting them off. I would recommend these for anybody that need to handle large windows and able to do it by your self. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Up to the job
customer_reviews.text: The product was - surprisingly in the age of Internet ad hype - every bit as 'heavy duty' as described. We didn't need to lift the 200 lbs as rated, but it was fully up to the task of lifting glass panels. So much better than what we found at Home Depot for a similar price.
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Faubert

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for installing and moving glass.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace the glass in my aluminum clad windows. Seal in glass was broken, windows were otherwise in good condition. I bought two of these to change some of the glass from outside and a fixed window. They worked great, I was totally confident that they would not come loose while handling the glass.
customer_reviews.author: mark steinhauer

product_meta.title: Qadira Premium Quality Heavy Duty Aluminum Suction Cup Plate Double Handle Professional Glass Puller/Lifter/Gripper
feature_bullets: This high quality suction cup's handle body made with durable aluminuim alloy and the suction pad made with natural rubber, very durable.
Great for lifting large glass, fix laminate floors as floor gap fixer, handling heavy mirror, moving windows tile granite sheet metal and any plane surface materials.
Maximum lifting Load capacity 220 Pounds in level, load capacity 200 Pounds in vertical.
Dimensions: 13 x 4.8 x 4.5 inches, The diameter of suction cups is 4-3/4 inch, Suction Pad thickness: 7 mm.
Require experiences on handling heavy duty suction cup!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars813 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
